result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi M Bessert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid directly to the Clerk of Court, 811 Harding Street, Waupaca WI  54981.

Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

Bond Terminated Slip
c: WC Jail

DAR used.
ADA Bolz appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Gelhar.
The state moves to amend the sole count in the information to prescription fraud, per Sec. 450.11 (7) (h).
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of guilty to the amended count.  Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained and the defendant was found guilty on the amended count.
Statements by counsel.
The Court sentences the defendant to 45 days in jail, with huber privileges.  That sentence is stayed and the defendant is placed on probation for a period of 12 months.
Conditions of probation: pay all supervision fees, undergo and complete all counseling and assessments deemed appropriate by the agent and abide by all treatment recommendations, maintain absolute sobriety, possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.
Defendant has 5 days of credit.
As a separate order, the defendant shall pay all court costs within 60 days. 
Update address per plea quest.
Appeal rights were provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on May 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Assistant District Attorney Kat Turner: Present 
Attorney Alex Gelhar present.
Defendant present.
Complaint received, reading waived.
Preliminary hearing questionnaire and waiver form filed.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.
Defendant questioned by the Court and advised of rights.
Court finds defendant waiving right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Court finds probable cause and binds over for arraignment. 
Information mirroring complaint to be filed.
Waive reading of information.
Plea - not guilty.
Bond recommendations by counsel.
$1,000.00 signature bond.
Cond: Report within 21 days to the Waupaca County Sheriff's Department to submit to the booking process.  You are required to make an appointment by calling (715) 942-1887. 
STC - BR 1 to schedule
